title: (BUG REPORT) Another Anivia Bug
body: With Anivia her E does double damage if the target is 'Chilled' by previously using Q or R on the target, however i have noticed when attacking the dragon (yet untested on Baron) because the dragon is immune to crowd control it is not affected by 'Chilled' when Anivia uses her Q or R on it and therefore it is impossible for her to Proc the double damage on her E, is this intentional? or should she be able to proc the double damage but cant because the dragon's immunity accidentally blocks the whole 'Chilled' effect and not just the slow?

replies.body: The dragon breaths fire. I'm pretty sure he is anything but chilled. No all comedy aside, dragon cannot be affected by crowd control so of course it would be intentional for him not be able to be chilled. So next time you make a post like this take "bug" out of the title and just say possible bug because you may confuse people.

Being 'Chilled' is not crowd control, the slow effect that comes from the 'Chilled' is crowd control. The dragon is still affected by Diana's moonlight and so Diana'a R gets to be Re-set, Gangplanks 'grog soaked blade' still works on the dragon I'm sure, its just the slowing factor that is removed, why isn't it the same for Anivia? Being 'chilled' and being 'slowed' are not the same, its the 'chilled' debuff that causes the slow, just like gangplanks passive. what i think has happened and why i think this is a 'Bug' is that the dragon's immunity should have removed the slow, but because the only effect 'chilled' has is the slow, the dragon's immunity has accidentally removed the whole debuff,

remember that the 'Chilled' debuff is specific to Anivia alone, her E only does double damage to 'chilled' targets not 'slowed' targets, this means that while the 'chilled' debuf causes a slow, it is not a slow itself.

Cos the dragon is not chilled k.

The dragon is always serious.
